website_summaries.verdict: Quality over-the-glasses goggles that may not fit over all glasses.
pros: Well made goggles that don't scratch that easily
Adjusts to fits comfortably snug even while wearing a helmet
Case has space for an extra lens
cons: May not fit over all glasses
Magnets are also not as strong as others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal goggles for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I used them today for the first time, and I'm a happy camper! For the price, I thought they did phenomenal. I saw some others wearing these goggles out today, men and women. I'm looking forward to having the replaceable lenses for sale, as I could really use multiples! And also, a polarized lens would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Moisture gets between lenses. Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Awful! Moisture must have gotten between the inner and outer lenses and dried. I couldn’t see a thing and couldn’t clean it. I think I wore them 2-3 time. Giant waste of money, but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Stone

customer_reviews.title: Definitely for a large face
customer_reviews.text: The mirrored lense was exactly what I was looking for and the foam felt like good quality. But I will be returning solely because these are GIANT. My head is on the smaller side I suppose but nothing drastically smaller than the next. But these dug in to my nose a little weird and hit the sides of my helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too small for regular glasses
customer_reviews.text: too small for a regular pair of glasses. Money spent on the silly case could make the goggles better. Don't be fooled by the exterior; the interior is small compared to my existing Scott otg goggles. Going to return these
customer_reviews.author: John Danilson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in used damaged condition
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed with this purchase. The box had been previously opened by someone else and the goggles had already been used. There were fingerprints all over the lense and the foam was damaged in places. I was also expecting these goggles to have a wider angle of view (they look to have a large lense from the outside), but the thick foam on the inside blocks the peripheral vision and the viewing angle isn't any better than old style goggles. Again, disappointed in the condition but also ultimately not the wide field of vision goggles I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: mpoe

customer_reviews.title: Restricts field of view
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Looks nice and lens swapping is easy. Hard shell case is a nice add-on. Cons: seriously limited field of view compared to standard goggles. Seriously, the frame protrudes so much in front of the face that it obstructs the vision on all four sides. As soon as I compared it to my old Anon's and a pair of cheaper off-brand (EnzoDate) goggles, I decided to not even bother testing it on the slopes. Going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Szymon

customer_reviews.title: Beyond worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've worn them on a three day snowboard trip and am about to again on another so if my opinion changes I will update. These were fantastic for the 3 days I've worn them out so far. No fog unless you're stationary but still rare. I tried breathing directly up into them to test the anti-fog and they hold up nicely. They look awesome, got a lot of compliments, and they are comfortable to wear. Crashed hard a few times and the magnets held, never fell out once; I watched my friend fall multiple times and his expensive anons wouldn't hold up as well. The clarity through the lenses are fantastic too. These are beyond worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever worn!
customer_reviews.text: I have been skiing for (50 years) and these are by far the best goggles I've ever worn! I have had many compliments and people asking me where did I get them. They fit my helmet to perfection and are very comfortable on my face. The lens is held in place by magnets that make it easy to switch the lens or remove for safe storage. These are a nicer goggle then the $220.00 pair of Smith's that my wife recently bought. The storage case is very high quality and effectively protects the lens when stored. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: todd thompson

customer_reviews.title: Fit OTG for young teen
customer_reviews.text: My kid is really liking these goggles. They are comfortable and he is able to wear his glasses under them so he can see better on the slopes. Note: He is a small 13 year old so his glasses are not huge - not sure how well they'll work for an adult with glasses, but they work great for him. We really like the removable, magnetic lens. Plan to purchase different lenses for different conditions. The magnets are really strong and the lens snaps in place when held closely. Definitely recommend as great ski goggles. Recommend as OTG goggles for people with small glasses.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Please buy this !!! Won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously just buy this !!!!!!!! Compared to $180 namebrand ones. These are just as great or even better Won't feel bad if you scratch them, and they are worth every penny. Please just buy them. The magnet is amazing, stayed on riding through winter park Colorado and had zero issues. And the lenses are perfect aswell. Easy to switch and the case it comes with is also great since you can add other lenses to the case so you have everything in one.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to order these due to the low price. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and value of these goggles after a week of skiing in the alps. The magnets hold the lens firmly. The case is a great bonus to protect the goggles. I also purchased a second lens and it was also very well done. I would definitely recommend these. Update Feb 2020 Used second year in the alps. These worked great in Sun and used orange in cloudy conditions. Think I'll buy another lens for darker conditions. Lens change very easy and are secure. I'm going to get a pair for my wife . Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Top notch quality and looks expensive!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to splurge this year on goggles but saw these and all the great reviews. I’m glad I did because they are awesome! I went off of the chart that shows what colors they recommend for brightness (sunny day vs cloudy day). I bought the purple lens color and I love the look of them! I also love that the lenses are interchangeable and I can’t wait to add to my lens collection for different looks. The packaging was cool too! Came with a sturdy case for the lens by itself. All around I’m very pleased. These exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kalia J

customer_reviews.title: Almost great
customer_reviews.text: These were almost perfect for the price. The quality of the goggle is good but the problem is the magnetic lens. The magnets are strong but a hard spill will still cause the lens to pop off. I caught an edge and hit the back of my head and the lens came off. Now there was snow/water on the inside of the lens which now caused fogging. Although I appreciate the ability to quickly change the lens, I really think there should be a way to lock the lens in place.
customer_reviews.author: HybridHB

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Bought them for my whole family!
customer_reviews.text: I'm over the need to spend $300 on goggles just because they are a name brand. These are so great and such a value! I love how interchangeable the lenses are and how many different colors you can get. It's so easy to change the lenses! Plus it comes with a nice carrying case, that has room for a spare lens so it makes it super convenient and keeps your lenses protected and organized. I received my first pair as a gift and loved them so much I bought them for my whole family. I've used mine for 2 seasons so far and they are holding up perfectly. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LindaYoshi

customer_reviews.title: They are ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The magnets don't hold the lens in very strongly. The second time I fell on my snowboard the lens flew off and another rider ran over it. My lens is scratched up now and can't be used. The replacement lenses are all $25 bucks a piece which is often more expensive than buying another pair of cheap goggles. Also I found the lenses scratch up really easily.
customer_reviews.author: Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Worked with my glasses
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price. I hadnt skiid since I needed glasses so I needed a pair that would fit over since I dont like contacts. I had used for 2 days last season and havent had any issues. Hoping to get more use this season. Ive noticed its easier to push my frames into the goggles before allowing the elastic to pull the goggles against my face because of how large my glasses are. The glasses just rest in the goggles rather than on your nose
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is the best goggles I've ever owned. I've had many big name brands and this one just fit like a glove. I like the fact that you can buy different lenses for it which I have done. Easy to change out and the lenses stay in place. Great design with the magnets. I do wear glasses and just like other goggles you should have a small pair or thin wire rimmed glasses to comfortably fit. They do not fog. You can't beat the price. Feels like good quality materials so these goggles should last.
customer_reviews.author: The Shelby review

customer_reviews.title: Solid goggles
customer_reviews.text: solid goggles for their price. I haven’t tested the scratch resistance, but the seem to have a coating on them to help substantiate that. What I have noticed is that they are not that great in the sun, they carry a lot of heat. Awesome for a stormy and cloudy cold day, but on a sunny one, you’re better off with regular sunglasses. Maybe that’s standard with goggles not just these ones, but just an observation.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua P

customer_reviews.title: No fogging. Looks great. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing googles for the price! No fogging what's so ever (2 days skiing). It has a magnetic lens, which is very neat because you don't even really need to remove your goggles if you want to scratch your eye or something.. just pop the lens off and put it back on after. But at the same time its strong enough that the lens didn't detach even once during my numerous falls! I hope they release more lens options for these, I'm definitely going to snatch a few up.. maybe a yellow one for clarity. The smoke one that came with it is great though, kept the sun out of my eyes without visibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Kept fogging up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these because of reviews and tried them for the first time last week while snowboarding on a trip to Colorado. Luckily I brought my old pair with me because these fogged up immediately on the first run and I couldn't get them to stay clear. I wore them for the 2nd run just to be sure but switched them out with my old Scott goggles after the same thing happened. They were also too big and kept resting on the bridge of my nose. These did not work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy R

customer_reviews.title: Great goggle, poor lense contrast
customer_reviews.text: Pluses: huge field of vision, nice case, awesome price, lenses change out nicely. Just look cool overall... Negatives: I wore the red lense out on a bluebird day and it did nothing to highlight variations in the snow. It washed out the inconsistencies, leaving me riding slow and nervous. I thought they'd have a red tint internally to contrast snow - they don't. It's just a clear view, slightly darkenened. I hope they have a lense that actually shows variations in the snow!? Also, someone please confirm if the Anon lenses will fit?? As I'm assuming they'd do a better job...(yes - I removed the protective plastic film from the lens and rode in them for several hours).
customer_reviews.author: Brett W

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these goggles. One for myself and one for my wife. We were very satisfied and impressed with my wife’s goggles however mine arrived damaged. We have no issues with the product itself, just the shipping and handling of the manufacturer. Every product should be shipped in its original box and packaging. There should be consistency. My wife’s goggles arrived in this big fancy OutdoorMasters box with a magnetic lid. Meanwhile mine arrived without the box, in a padded yellow envelope, with the lens scratched. Again, product-wise, we were satisfied. However the inconsistency in the packaging and allowing for your products to arrive damaged is what merits 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love these things! I sold 2 people on them my first weekend of use
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and highly functional. What more do you want out of a set of goggles? There is no distortion and vision is perfect. I LOOOOOVE how easy it is to swap lenses with the magnetic frames and lenses. I thought for sure this would cause some wind to sneak in or maybe fogging issues? But after 6 days I had absolutely 0 issues. I had a number of complements on how great they looked. And when I was talking them up on how well they performed and how little they cost, I know at least 2 of my friends that bought the exact same pair. Probably a different color, not everyone loves orange like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lee

customer_reviews.title: Saved my eyes!!
customer_reviews.text: It was my first time skiing ever, so I decided to get a good pair of goggles. I fell really bad a few times and flipped over my head ( I was falling down the slope for a little bit, and tried to stop myself with my hands and even my head - was falling with my face down), so I basically my helmet saved my head and these goggles saved my eyes, not joking. Apart from that, I loved how fancy they look and their ability not to let much light in when it was bright. Thank you for them!
customer_reviews.author: Antanina

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying this is maybe my first time writing review and I have had Amazon for awhile. These were the worst pair of goggles I have ever used. I took them to Utah this weekend and by the time I was done with my first run they were fogged and let moisture in the entire day. I had to take them off and borrow a friends spare. Tried them again 2 days later and got the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great Googles, Lenses Super Easy to Change Out
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these goggles and lenses snowboarding in Utah and they are holding up great. Goggles are comfortable and the lenses are crazy easy to swap out. No problems with fogging, and have not had any problems with the lenses popping out if I crash. Very happy with my purchase and these are performing just as well, if not better than the expensive name brands. I have used them in cold blizzard conditions and sunny bluebird days. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: None Ya

customer_reviews.title: Good value googles
customer_reviews.text: Checks all the google feature boxes for me at a very competitive cost. Better in every way to my more expensive name brand goggles. Will eventually purchase multiple magnetic interchangeable lenses for varying light conditions. Seem to be well made --- but haven't used them long enough to comment on durability. If they turn out to be as durable as my other googles, I'd up my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but scratch easily
customer_reviews.text: 1st review 1 month after: These are beautiful! I've never gotten so many compliments on my goggles. Wore them to burning man and they let the perfect amount of light in/dust out. They were also fine for nighttime as well, since there's so many lights. I ski with them too and people on the slopes love them also! 2nd review 8 months later: these scratch super easily and almost need to be replaced after one ski season! Sad they're not more durable and will have to go with a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Fit great and look pricey!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with these goggles. I've used them now for the entire ski season, and I'm thrilled with the purchase. I think I'll definitely buy another lens though. I bought the darkest opacity, which is great for sunny days, but on cloudy/snowy days it definitely becomes difficult to see, but that's no fault of the product. You just need different goggles/lenses for different conditions.
customer_reviews.author: aggie4life

customer_reviews.title: BEST GOGGLES. I bought these for my fiance and ...
customer_reviews.text: BEST GOGGLES. I bought these for my fiance and I for our family trip to Colorado. Not only did we get compliments on them, but they worked great. *Did NOT fog *Perfect wind protection *Clarity was great! *Perfect for shaded and bright areas on the slopes Definitely recommend them to anyone looking for goggles who is not wanting to spend a few hundred for brand names. They actually worked better than both of our name brand goggles!!
customer_reviews.author: Madi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and the magnetic lenses are great
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and the magnetic lenses are great, but I ultimately returned these because their limited field of vision. Like other frameless goggles the frame is actually on the inside and that makes the field of vision smaller. The bottom of the goggles were so pronounced you couldn't just look down with your eyes, you had to move your head to see down.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Cheap dye
customer_reviews.text: When these goggles get wet the dye runs onto your clothes. I bought my wife a pink pair for Christmas. The first time she used them they ruined her white ski jacket. Hopefully we can get the stains out.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID JACOBSON

customer_reviews.title: and they just looked pretty massive. It may have been the helmet I ...
customer_reviews.text: You can see out of these really well, but they were actually way bigger on my face than I expected. I have an average size head/face I would say, and they just looked pretty massive. It may have been the helmet I was wearing. I'll keep using them though because you can see really well out of them!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great visibility
customer_reviews.text: Awesome visibility in both, snowy and sunny weather. I was worried I would have limited visibility in cloudy/snowy weather because they’re darker and meant for sunny days, but they were awesome even on the day when it was raining and snowing. I have a smaller face, so sometimes they would push down on my nose and make it a little hard to breathe, but simply adjusting them a little higher up and putting the helmet a little further back, they fit great and the visibility was awesome. Definitely a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Flores

customer_reviews.title: Tag says "Kids Goggles" but..
customer_reviews.text: Tag says "Kids goggles" but they fit my XL adult head just fine. The optics look good. The peripheral views are nowhere as good as my old scott goggles, but these outdoormasters are designed for "over eye glasses" and probably give up some addtional thickness and view angle due to that alone. If you dont need to where glasses under goggles, you might want to go elsewhere for less tunnel vision. Eitherway, these are a Great Value!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: Great goggles. Can't go wrong. Comfortable and good fit, including over glasses. No fog. Awesome array of optional lenses in both colors and degree of darkness. Easy, fast, lens change. Great price for such functionality. Thoughtful strap latch placement does not interfere with clip on helmet. This Recommendation from a skier in 58th season.
customer_reviews.author: Stata Babka

customer_reviews.title: The dark lens looks awesome with a cool reflective look
customer_reviews.text: I got these goggles with the plan of later buying a more transparent lens. The dark lens looks awesome with a cool reflective look, but are no good for night (which is why i plan on buying the transparent lens). I really like the look of the lens covers everything, doing a goof job of hiding the frame. The lens is really easy to remove and does not fog up a lot. If they goggles fog up, they usually clear up within a couple seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Yefimets

customer_reviews.title: From a coolness and functionality perspective - these are AWESOME. If you happen to push the limits a ...
customer_reviews.text: From a coolness and functionality perspective - these are AWESOME. If you happen to push the limits a bit, maybe do some back-country skiing - these might not be the right choice. We were back-country skiing and I took a tumble in the deep stuff, I was covered from head to toe, and snow everywhere - except where the goggle lens was - it popped off, couldn't find it so had to use my sunglasses (thus the -1 star). The magnetic connections are great when skiing (in-bounds) and make a really great lunch/drink conversation when you are in the bar.
customer_reviews.author: R U A DAD?

customer_reviews.title: Fit over glasses and don't fog.
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They fit over my glasses and I can carry several lenses to switch out depending upon the level of sunlight or for evening skiing. I have no problems with fogging like previous goggles. The magnetic lens system is quite strong and I have never had a lens pop out, even after an epic face-plant. But when you want to switch lenses because day has turned to night, the lens comes out easily and bang, you're ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Divecon

customer_reviews.title: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THESE GOGGLES!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THESE GOGGLES!!! For the price, these goggles are simply amazing! They have a great field of view, are extremely comfortable, and they look and feel like $300 goggles!! Oh and did I mention they look incredible?!?! The magnetic lens technology works fantastically. I bought bright rainbow lenses for snowboarding during the day, and bought clear lenses for night boarding. It could not be easier to simply pop off the lenses to replace or clean them. For the price, I'm pretty sure its impossible to beat the looks, comfort, and function of these goggles. As a casual snowboarder, its not worth spending hundreds on big name goggles when these are so much cheaper and practically just as good.
customer_reviews.author: AllAboutDatSwag

customer_reviews.title: Actual viewing area much less than the size of the lens
customer_reviews.text: Just receive the goggles and was surprised that the actual viewing (from inside) is much less than the size of the lens. No less than normal goggles but I was thinking the large lens area would open up the viewing area - not so. I was willing to wear these goggle with the huge lens (looks like giant eyes of a fly) if it also increased the viewing area. I thinking about returning them to get a normal set of goggles from a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely awesome and worth the price! I’ve used them in -3° weather and 60° weather... I’ve used them in rain and I’ve used them in snow... I’ve used them when they are blowing snow like crazy on the mountain and never had an issue with them getting foggy... no clue why anyone would spend close to $300 on Oakley’s... you’re just paying for a brand name... I will definitely be purchasing more lenses to change up the colors! Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid goggles, great for this price point
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty great, the lenses fit well, magnets are strong, they're very comfortable, and they don't fog up. The only issues I have would be that the blue lens does scratch pretty easily and also they ice up worse than some goggles. Overall though well worth it and definitely a good option unless maybe you're a super hardcore slope rat.
customer_reviews.author: JOS

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit over my glasses
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these goggles did not fit over my glasses. I have one pair that is 5 1/2" wide at the lenses and sits at a normal distance from the face. I have another pair that is 5 1/4" wide and sits much closer to the face. The goggles were very uncomfortable with the first pair and physically impossible with the second. For what it's worth, I have a fairly large (60cm) head. I had much better luck with Smith's OTG goggles, so others in my situation might want to try those.
customer_reviews.author: dwhite78

customer_reviews.title: Fits great over glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my snowboarding son who wears glasses. He loves how they fit over his glasses with no gaps or to much pressure on his ear pieces of his glasses. He has tried other brands, but they would put to much pressure on the ear pieces of his glasses, which in turn would give him a headache. Thank you Outdoor Master for making a product that is comfortable and helps my snowboarder look cool!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Good except for a defect in the lens
customer_reviews.text: There is a small area in the center of the lens that is distorted. See the circled area in the attached picture to get an idea of what I mean. It seems small, but it gives the effect that objects move around if you turn your head, and it gets quite annoying after just a short time. Other than the distortion, there is a lot to like, especially at this price point: - The magnetic mount seems strong enough. - The blue mirror on the lens looks good. - The frame and strap are comfortable and seem like they would be durable. - Looks like it has plenty of ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lance

customer_reviews.title: Nice goggles for the price
customer_reviews.text: They came quickly and look nice these are going to be a Christmas present so I can't comment on the fit. My son is mostly going to be skiing at night so I got the clear lense and I also got a brown tinted polarized lense for the times he may ski in brighter conditions. I was skeptical about the lens staying on because it's magnetic but it seems to hold on strong.
customer_reviews.author: linnay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get the lens smudged and then you'll spend ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get the lens smudged and then you'll spend the whole day cleaning and recleaning. Was hoping this was large enough to fit over my glasses, which are small glasses. It just barely fits, but is uncomfortable and my glasses actually touch against the lens. They look really cool though. My friend immediately regretted buying some cheap Smith goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Risto

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. Very happy w this product. It fit comfortably over my helmet and on my face. Didn’t fog even when wearing a face mask. I bought a secondary lens for brighter days. It was super easy to swap lenses. It came w a great case to store both the goggles and extra lens. Would recommend this as a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J-Ro

customer_reviews.title: The magnets are very strong and the lens color and quality seem to be as good or better than the 200$ comparable googles
customer_reviews.text: Initial quality seems outstanding. I plan on using them soon for snowboarding. The magnets are very strong and the lens color and quality seem to be as good or better than the 200$ comparable googles. No matter if you have these for a back up pair use all the time seems like the best deal out there. Added bonus for me is no name brand to make folks want to steal them altho they do look like other more expensive pairs... Will follow up with more after i have used them a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Look Nice, Work Well
customer_reviews.text: Sweet looking pair of goggles. They go great with my Giro helmet. Wore them in this past snow storm while shoveling snow, and they worked great until I put them on top of my head. Put them back on my face after a few minutes and they fogged up. Eventually they un-fogged. I have never had an issue with them fogging on the mountain. I like how easy it is to change out the lenses. Looking forward to getting a few more; right now I have the mirrored dark one. Also dig the case and carrying pouch that come with. Packaging was legit too.
customer_reviews.author: Ferris

customer_reviews.title: but these had some good reviews. Took them out skiing for a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit leery of googles that cost under $50, but thought I'd give them a try. I usually get Scott or Smith, but these had some good reviews. Took them out skiing for a couple of days in Montana this xmas.. it was windy and cold and very sunny/bright and they worked flawlessly. I am not sure of their durability, but time will tell. They come with a soft and hard shell case which surprised me at the price. I got these for bright days and they were great both in the bright sun and in the shadows. Very pleased so far@@
customer_reviews.author: cashmando

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you buy most of the time, but with these I would say the consumer gets the better end of this deal! Only down sides are, after using them, that you almost have to get the inside dirty and wet and blow dry them out before the anti-fog really works! Finally, the fit of the googles were a bit different than what I was use too, so that is where the discomfort came from I'm sure. Other than that they are perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.author: K. Bales

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: These did a great job keeping snow out of my eyes and I loved being able to swap out the lenses as the conditions changed. 2 of the 3 days on the slopes were very cloudy and I put lighter lenses in and when the sun came out I'd quickly swap the lens over to the darker one. The frame was comfortable and the strap was easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alonso

customer_reviews.title: Googles are awesome. Bought two yellow and purple
customer_reviews.text: Googles are awesome. Bought two yellow and purple. One in a box, sealed package as it should be. Another one is without box. Came in a plastic wrap. Looks like used. Might return as it is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Evgeniy Tsigankov

customer_reviews.title: Best value out there
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for upcoming trip to Keystone. I was a little hesitant based on the price. Very happy with the purchase. The fit is great, quality is good. The only time I had fogging issues was riding the lift and wearing a face mask. If you breathe heavy while wearing a face mask they will fog, but I don't know of any goggles this won't happen with. Other than that they were awesome. I also bought the fuscia lens for low light and use multiple times already. Lenses are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R.

customer_reviews.title: Just increadible
customer_reviews.text: Alright, so I got these goggles last year for 2016 winter season and they performed amazing. The goggles were so good I purchased the 80% green spare goggles for night time riding and snowy conditions. And let me tell you I rode in 18 degree blizzard conditions with 20+ inches fallen and didn't fog up at all. I own 2 other pair of goggles and they are name brands and don't perform as well as these goggles surprisingly. Amazing goggles, cheap, and stylish
customer_reviews.author: mr

customer_reviews.title: Very cool looking googles and easy too use
customer_reviews.text: Very cool looking googles and easy too use. The lenses that came with it works only for sunny days but you can get away with some clouds. I recommend buying extra lenses because they do tend to fog up after a few hours. However they are so easy to use that you can just swap them out and keep going. Really like the product and the case it's also cool looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not scratch resistant and remained foggy
customer_reviews.text: The goggles look great and the magnetic mechanism is cool. The first day I wore them skiing, they mostly remained clear. On the second day, I could not keep them unfogged. I used the carrying bag to wipe them off and this somehow scratched the goggles to wear I could not see well out of the middle of the left side. I ended up taking them off for the remainder of the day and using a friend's old pair of goggles the next day that did not fog up at all. I really wanted these to work.
customer_reviews.author: Hesham

customer_reviews.title: They look great and the lenses are easy to swap out but ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m a little undecided on these. They look great and the lenses are easy to swap out but I’m not convinced the tinting is particularly good. At the price I’m not sure it’s fair to compare them to an Oakley lens so I won’t dock them anything for that but these do scratch easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Good goggles at a good price. Hunt around a little more if you have a giant head like me.
customer_reviews.text: Good goggles at a good price if you have a medium sized head. These are a little big on my girlfriend, and just slightly small on my giant sized dome. They seemed to be designed by people with smaller noses. But the padding may break in. There is nothing wrong with these goggles that doesn't directly relate to my circus sized head. Still a decent deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grieco

customer_reviews.title: A great value, good customer support.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good goggle for a great price. I had an issue with my first order where the lens would fog between the inner and outer lens and I couldn't clear it. I contacted the company and they sent me a new goggle. I wore them out to the hill today, and while not perfect, it is much better than the last for clearing fog. Overall, we're very happy with the value and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: B review

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, great goggles!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, awesome goggles! I could not decide which goggles to purchase on Amazon. I spent hours reading reviews and comparing different brands. I didn't know which ones would be best, as I have never heard of many and could not try them on with my gear. I ordered these, and they fit awesomely, and work great. Due to the complaints from others about scratching, when mine are not in use I keep them in the protective case that comes with the goggles. Also, the lens come off easily to swap the colors (but are absolutely secure while on the frames). I really enjoy these lenses, and will recommend them to friends!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a pair of these googles with the 60% blue lens and two extra lenses (80% poloarized and 20%) polarized for $100 combined. Quality construction, easy to swap out replacement lenses, and they don't fog. I think these are almost identical in quality to name brand goggles. They do run a little large. I would say I have a medium sized face and they fit pretty good, howver, I would find it hard to recommed these goggles with ladies or anyone with a smaller size face.
customer_reviews.author: pbike908

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Goggles!
customer_reviews.text: Great Goggles for Snowboarding or Skiing! I got these a few weeks ago and after using them, I fell in love with them! The carrying case is awesome and super sleek. The ability to change in and out of different lenses is awesome to through its magnetic system. They are also extremely flexible and durable. I took some hard falls and the lens held its own. Very adjustable to all different head sizes. Fogging isn't much of an issue unless you keep it on your head and you're becoming pretty hot. Keeping them on your face and not your forehead will definitely prevent the whole fogging thing though. Overall, extremely happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect & they hold my glasses steady. I like the ability to change lenses instead of having to switch to another full set. The magnetic lens allows you to go inside without having to take them completely off which can be nerve wrecking when you only need to be inside a few seconds & then back out into the sunny snow. Plus having multiple levels of light cutting is good for cloudy days.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Really colorful goggles!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife pretty close to a ski trip we just did. Her old goggles basically fell apart after 10 years. The goggles worked great. No complaints about fogging or fit. Worked well with her helmet. The great thing about them is how colorful the lens & strap are. I could spot my wife from very far away. You can see how bright the pink strap and color fade lens are. She thought they passed enough light through. Nice packaging, too. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: so typically sunny conditions Might order a more clear lens for gloomy conditions as the magnetic feature literally takes like 3 seconds to change
customer_reviews.text: Wicked quality. Clean, minimal strap design. 2 suggestions: company should pay a little more detail to the stitching of the black logo on the strap, and make the carry bag/ pouch a little bigger because it is really snug and I somewhat have to cram the goggles in. I have not tested them out on the slopes yet because they came in several hours too late. Using at Lake Tahoe and Central California mountains, so typically sunny conditions Might order a more clear lens for gloomy conditions as the magnetic feature literally takes like 3 seconds to change.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Love the magnetic clips to switch out lenses.
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are awesome! The storage bag is great and has a little sleeve thing built in for the lenses. Sadly I just discovered this. My lenses have gotten a little bit of a scratch on them. I’m not sure if it was from the case and me not know to put them in the sleeve or my tumbles on the slopes? But they are not bad enough that I need to get new ones, it’s just somewhat fuzzy for the vision at the spot if the scratch. Again these are great to by! I probably just needed to take care of them better!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly R.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I recently took a four day trip to Montana to do some skiing. I bought these goggles as a backup pair for my nice Smith goggles. These goggles were exceptional for their price point. The magnet feature works well, and holds even on hard falls. The goggles fogged a bit when breathing heavily but that is expected when it was -29 Fahrenheit. The cons: The goggles aren't polarized, so some terrain features don't stand out (especially in low light). Additionally, these goggles seem to get scratched semi-easily. For the price, I would absolutely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Goggles Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these goggles with the REVO red VLT 10% lenses for sunny days and the green VLT 81% lenses for cloudy and night use. I have been using them for skiing in Park City. They are absolutely amazing. They have a large field of view, fit perfectly with my helmet, and do not fog up. The low VLT lenses are great when it is bright and the high VLT lenses are great when it is cloudy. The case they come in allows me to carry them both for when conditions change. I actually liked these goggles so much that I bought a second pair for my wife. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, don't fog, seem very durable after a rough week of boarding.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these not expecting much for the price, but was blown away with the comfort level, lack of fogging and durability. Just back from a week in Tahoe, and they were great. The 10% lenses were great for sunny days, and ordered some 65% for those overcast days. The ability to switch lenses is awesome. One negative - I tried to wear fairly small glasses under them (I just need them at twilight especially) and couldn't make it work. The glasses would get pushed against my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McGowan

customer_reviews.title: Go buy them
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in 20 degree temps at White Pass in Washington. Fit and sealed with zero fogging issues and secured well to my Marker helmet. I will be purchasing additional lenses for different light conditions. Glad I spent $10 more for the pro versions. It was hailing and snowing during the weekend and these were great! I compared to Zioniar, Smith, and non interchangeable lens Outdoor Master and these fit best.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great for bright light skiing conditions
customer_reviews.text: Skied with these all winter. Very comfortable with wide vision and no fogging. These are great on bright snow, which is what I needed. These goggles are not so great when snowing or with low/flat light conditions. I don't expect one pair of goggles to handle the wide variety of light conditions while skiing. That's why I have now have 2 pairs fo goggles: these for bright lights and a second pair for low/flat light conditions. I'm now a happy advanced skier!
customer_reviews.author: SharksFan

customer_reviews.title: Professional looking and high quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very professional and high quality product. The goggles have just the right amount of refelction and tilt. The style is good for those who don't like rims around the lenses or the slits I see in some other rimless goggles. OutDoorMaster continues to show high quality and professionalism in their now near elite performance winter gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell S.

customer_reviews.title: These actually worked much better than I thought they would
customer_reviews.text: These actually worked much better than I thought they would. I used them this season at Winter Park in CO. I went out for 4 days of snowboarding and these held up perfectly. The only time they slightly fogged was when I pulled my mask above my nose and mouth to breath on the lenses. The whole magnetic clips are awesome. I will just buy different lenses and can use this mask anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Ben May

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good quality, great look!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ski mask for all conditions. Great field of vision and comfortable. I have the blue lens for sunny days and the green lens for cloudy or snowy days and it's a great combination. I've had expensive masks before and these are as good without the price tag. Wearing these gives a fun alien look that's a plus!
customer_reviews.author: bigup

customer_reviews.title: Fits Smith Optics Holt Helmet perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fog up, great clarity, magnet system is super easy to swap lenses as the sun went down, but strong enough to stay on when I took a digger as I flew down a black diamond. Perfect fit with my Smith Optics Holt helmet. I'm done buying expensive Oakleys and my buddy was shocked at how similar these seemed to his $300 Anon goggles. Also surprised at how many people were wearing these at Okemo in VT, including 3 of us in my group!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and attention to detail
customer_reviews.text: Love these goggles, bought them for a snowboard trip and have only good things to say about them. First off, the price and quality is unbeatable, a friend of mine bought the dragon nfx 2 goggles around the same time(well over 150$ goggles) and I’d still take these given the choice. The tint looks great, magnetized lens feels really sturdy and I was most surprised by the box it arrived in. Being a cheaper goggle I didn’t expect much but was amazed when it came in an even nicer box than the dragon brand did, Along with the included lens bag. Overall I would greatly recommend these goggles to anyone looking for a great price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Now I've used these several times I can write a review. They are very high quality, never fail to get compliments on them. I have a darker pair and lens that is for overcast/snow days. Changing lenses is easy, and the case can fit into a coat pocket with an extra lens for inconsistent cover days. Strap is rubberized on inside so it stays against helmet well. Fogging hasn't been an issue so far. Can't speak to durability, no scratches so far. Pretty great value, overall.
customer_reviews.author: Cale Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Goggles!
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are awesome. For the price you cannot beat them. I bought these plus two other lenses for the same price as my previous pair (Oakley). The ability to change lenses in less than 2 minutes is amazing. I love the fact that I can switch from full sun lenses to overcast lenses while on the chair lift. You will not regret getting these.
customer_reviews.author: R. ODell

customer_reviews.title: They don't fog up
customer_reviews.text: These goggles are amazing. I got them because of the magnetic lenses (which are also amazing). They don't fog up and they fit like a glove. I've used two of my three lenses and they both work great. I would definitely recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bates

customer_reviews.title: You get more than what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Used these goggles for our 4 day Snowshoe trip and they performed great. I used them with and without a helmet and they fit both ways. I also used them with and without a face mask and had no issues with fogging. They were comfortable and fit well. I loved the large lenses for a full view when coming down the slopes. Our trip we had a few days in the teens and a few in the 30-40 degree range and the goggles performed well each day. Had no issues with finger prints or smudging either.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding ski/snowboard googles for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for great ski/snowboard googles for a great price, look no further. I have been using these googles for almost a year now and they still provide awesome protection like the first time I used them. The googles are quite comfortable with/without a helmet and have many adjustment options for various head types. What's also great about the googles is that they provide protection in various weather types, sun exposure etc. I am quite satisfied with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tomer Stavitsky

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfortable but slightly cheap
customer_reviews.text: Great goggles, they tend to look slightly cheap but have an edgy design and are really comfy. Definitely a great choice for people that don't want to spend tons of money in snowboarding / skiing gear. They come with a handy zipper bag to protect them!
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for an amazing price, but peripheral vision is slightly compromised
customer_reviews.text: Goggles just came in the mail yesterday. They look great, and fit very comfortably on my face. The lenses swap out easily; if the lighting changes while you’re on the mountain it’s no problem as the goggles case has enough room to carry an extra lens. The only thing I can fault this product for is it’s lack of peripheral vision, I feel as though the lower part of my vision is a little compromised compared to some of my other goggles, but I can’t complain considering it’s only $75 for both the goggles and an extra lens. I haven’t had a chance to try them out on the mountain yet, but I will update once I do.
customer_reviews.author: Garet Helwig

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty great. Looked even better. Only problem I had was that the air flow coming through to keep it from fogging up kept my face cold. But that could have been that they just weren't all that great...and it was cold out. Only got 1 use out of them so far. Will update as I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: the product holds up to its description.
customer_reviews.text: i went skiing for the first time and it was extremely bright out and eventually began to snow and we had some white out... these goggles met the challenge. they were perfect for both seeing conditions. oh, and they didn't fog up. i love them.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne R.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and fit. Yard sale’d hard and goggles where essentially unharmed- i was knocked out and broke some bones but goggles where fine
customer_reviews.author: Username withheld

customer_reviews.title: Amazing goggles! Better look and feel than big name brand goggles in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing goggles, especially for $50!! Seem to be high quality, they feel sturdy and look great! I love the Blue VLT-15% lenses! I am returning a pair of $100 Smith Chromapop goggles in favor of these. The most incredible/impressive part of all is that they were delivered only 12 hours after I placed my order, which was a whole day early!! Definitely recommend these ski goggles!
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Terracina

customer_reviews.title: Best Goggles I’ve Owned
customer_reviews.text: The quality/value of this product is outrageous. I’ve been snowboarding for 20+ years, generally using mid range SPY goggles and these were far superior. It includes a protective covering and carrying bag. For the price, I’ll never go back. Even the packaging was super delux, I’m not sure how they’re making money. You should buy these.
customer_reviews.author: David Piper

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: Craftsmanship is great, look is great, functionality is even better. When all my friends goggles were fogging up on a frigid powder day, mine remained clear and perfect. The magnetic lens stayed securely in place. Can't believe the value of these- I didn't have high expectations given the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for Price
customer_reviews.text: These goggles have worked great for me. They're comfortable and the lenses are very clear to see through. With that said, the lenses do scratch very easily. My snowboard lightly bumped into my goggles when they were on my helmet and scratched up a portion of the lense. Luckily, it was near the nose bridge so not in field of vision but still they are not very durable when it comes to scratch proof. You get what you pay for! Overall though, I am satisfied with the goggles so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality goggles for an incredible price – comparable to Anon M2's
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these goggles! Bought them for a recent trip to Colorado which also happened to be my first time snowboarding. :) They were great. Super comfortable, never fogged and got tons of compliments! A good friend of mine who went on the trip with us owns Anon M2 goggles and couldn't get over how nice these were for the price. He said they were almost the same exact thing and if he had known about them he would have bought them instead. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen McFee

customer_reviews.title: No fogging
customer_reviews.text: Easy to change lenses. I use the yellow most of the time. Shopped lots of expensive goggles. If you aren’t ready for photochromatic lens, then this is a versatile pair that has taken the place of a mid-range transmission Electric’s. Goggles and the extra lens both came with protective bag. Zip-up case isn’t rigid, which saves space in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: RD3

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable on face.
customer_reviews.text: Either pinches the nose too firmly or pressed in on bottom area of eyes. When I alternate between my smith goggles and these there us a noticable difference between each pair's foam with the Smith being significantly softer and more comfortable. Unfortunately, I will be returning mine, which I hate to do because the price is so good.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Goggles at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that these would be any good given the price. However, these are amazing goggles and an extremely fair price. I've skied 5 days in them so far - cloudy days, super bright days, overcast days and even at night (I have 3 lenses). They have never fogged up, they fit great and the lenses are top notch and easy to swap out when conditions change. These goggles were a score!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dial

customer_reviews.title: Distorted and not great
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look and feel of these however the color is not done well. If you look to the side you see in a completely different color than if straight forward. Made us a bit dizzy and distorted things. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First time snowboarder, loved the price point for these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my first time ever going snowboarding. They came exactly as described with a soft case and hard case. The lens is interchangable. The lens it comes with is perfect for a bright clear day however I suggest getting a lighter color for any day that is overcast or raining or snowing. I did have problems with fogging but talking to the local Colorado mountain people it sounded like it didn't matter how much you spent on goggles they will all for under the right circumstances. For price and functionality and being a first time skier I can recommend these with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: notoriousew

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Fit well and made well. I bought a few additional lenses which change easily and mount securely. Why pay 5 times more for a name? Buying these plus a lift ticket at most mountains and still come out ahead.
customer_reviews.author: KWheel

product_meta.title: OutdoorMaster Ski Goggles PRO - Frameless, Interchangeable Lens 100% UV400 Protection Snow Goggles for Men & Women
feature_bullets: PERFORMANCE SKI GOGGLES WITH FRAMELESS DESIGN - Large spherical, frameless lens provides a truly unobstructed & clear view of the slopes. Designed for ULTIMATE PERFORMANCE & COMFORT.
INTERCHANGEABLE LENS SYSTEM - Enjoy a wide range of extra lenses. Swap for day/night & different weather conditions. CHOOSE AMONG 20+ DIFFERENT LENSES. Extra lenses sold separately.
OTG (OVER-THE-GLASSES) DESIGN - The Ski Goggles PRO features an OTG design that lets you wear your glasses under the goggles. All lenses are ANTI-FOG COATED & offers 100% UV400 PROTECTION.
UNIVERSAL HELMET COMPATIBILITY - Extra long elastic strap ensures GREAT HELMET COMPATIBILITY with all helmets. Suitable for both adults & teens.
WHAT YOU GET: 1 x OutdoorMaster Ski Goggles PRO, 1 x Protective Case, 1 x Carrying Pouch, and our CUSTOMER-FAVORITE 1 YEAR WARRANTY and friendly customer service.
